ratings.comment: Dr. Warmath was one of my favorite profs at UGA and one of the nicest down to earth people. She was easy to reach out to and helped anytime you would need it. The class was not too hard, but required attendance to participate in group projects almost every class. I would take her class again.

Took FHCE 4100/6100 at UGA for my minor course and it was 100% group project all semester with an individual project at the end. She was an awesome professor that mainly graded us clearly alongside her asst. professor Chen. Would take this class again!

To be clear, I am a UGA student since she is at UGA now. She is always busy, so she has no time for us. She is interested in everything, every topic, every person, every work that makes her busier. I don't think she is interested in teaching, so I learned nothing, but an easy A class. I wish she knew how to pick and choose, focus, and organize.

Dee is one of the most knowledgeable professors I've had at UW. The class is basically one big group project though, and sometimes the grading can be a bit ambiguous. The exam wasn't too bad, but the topics on it could have been explained a bit better. Just do the pre-recorded lecture notes every night before class and you'll be fine.
She is so amazing at what she does. She's very knowledgeable at everything she teaches. You can learn so much from her; I regret not taking more of her classes.

So at first I was going to drop CS301 It is literally so hard if youve never taken a Stats class or dont have excel experience. She moves really fast through examples and youre at risk of falling super behind during lecture. However, if you have a solid group you can get an A and Dee is super super caring and is always willing to help. I got an A!

This special topics class was a semester long group project. It is not that it was hard, it is just that when Dee attempts to explain things, she talks in theory and goes off on these rants that never seem to add up. It seemed that every time we went to Dee for questions we left with more, she always made us more confused. No class structure.

Dee is extremely helpful and well respected by her students. Advanced Consumer Analytics was a special topics course using excel and working in small groups. Material was tough and a bit confusing at times but she is always willing to help (even if that means calling her at  home - very willing) Her feedback and help on the projects was the best.

Very knowledgeable and experienced in retailing. However, she is a tough grader. You work in class covering different channels in the retail industry and giving a group presentation after each channel. Bad group=Bad grades.
